intro: Dampiera omissa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dampiera, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in coastal areas, often in heathlands or open woodlands. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, and it is known for its ability to thrive in damp, coastal environments. Dampiera omissa is an important component of the local flora and is often found in coastal dunes and salt marshes.
